iana.template_text:
(last updated 2008-01-24)

Name : Kazunari Kubota

Email : kbt&nttdocomo-std.com

MIME media type name : Application

MIME subtype name : Vendor Tree - vnd.oma.poc.invocation-descriptor+xml

Required parameters : none

Optional parameters :
none

Encoding considerations : 8bit
This media type may require encoding on transports not capable of handling 8 bit text.

Security considerations :
This content type contains the information for initiating a PoC Session.
The vnd.oma.poc.invocation-descriptor+xml typed content itself does not provide either 
privacy or integrity protection.
This media type does not contain executable content.


Interoperability considerations :
This content type provides a format for exchanging information for initiating a PoC Session.

Published specification :
The OMA PoC Invocation Specification is published at http://www.openmobilealliance.org/.

Applications which use this media :
Applications that support OMA Push to Talk over Cellular (PoC) service.

Additional information :

1. Magic number(s) : none
2. File extension(s) : none
3. Macintosh file type code : none
4. Object Identifiers: none

Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : OMA Push to Talk over Cellular (POC) Working Group
2. Email : technical-comments&mail.openmobilealliance.org

Intended usage : Common
This content type provides a format for exchanging information for initiating a PoC Session.

Author/Change controller : The OMA PoC specifications are outputs of the work item of the OMA 
Push to Talk over Cellular (POC) Working Group. The Open Mobile Alliance has change control over 
these specifications, with mailing list address technical-comments&mail.openmobilealliance.org

(file created 2008-01-24)
